com.example.lab3_restapi

Class UserPreferences

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.example.lab3_restapi.UserPreferences

  • public class UserPreferences
extends java.lang.Object
    This class holds a reference to the SharedPreferences that is used to store user settings for the app.

    It is intended to be instantiated every time a value needs to be retrieved from the user's settings.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      UserPreferences(android.content.Context context)
      Default constructor.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String getCity()
      Retrieve the user's city for which to fetch weather forecasts.
      int getMaxHourlyForecast()
      Retrieve the limit for the number of hourly forecast displayed in the Today tab.
      long getRefreshInterval()
      Retrieve the duration between two calls to the API for new data.
      java.lang.String getSpeedUnit()
      Get the velocity unit associated with the current unit system set by the user (km/h or mph).
      java.lang.String getTempUnit()
      Get the temperature unit associated with the current unit system set by the user (K, °C or °F).
      java.lang.String getUnits()
      Retrieve the unit system to use for displaying weather data.

    • Constructor Detail

      • UserPreferences

        public UserPreferences(android.content.Context context)
        Default constructor.
        Parameters:
        context - required to access the default shared preferences for the app

    • Method Detail

      • getCity

        public java.lang.String getCity()
        Retrieve the user's city for which to fetch weather forecasts.
        Returns:
        The preferred user's city.

      • getUnits

        public java.lang.String getUnits()
        Retrieve the unit system to use for displaying weather data.

        This can be one of three values :

        • Standard
        • Metric
        • Imperial
        Returns:
        The current unit system set by the user.

      • getTempUnit

        public java.lang.String getTempUnit()
        Get the temperature unit associated with the current unit system set by the user (K, °C or °F).
        Returns:
        The associated unit.

      • getSpeedUnit

        public java.lang.String getSpeedUnit()
        Get the velocity unit associated with the current unit system set by the user (km/h or mph).
        Returns:
        The associated unit.

      • getRefreshInterval

        public long getRefreshInterval()
        Retrieve the duration between two calls to the API for new data.
        Returns:
        The duration in minutes (1, 5, 10, 30 or 60 minutes).

      • getMaxHourlyForecast

        public int getMaxHourlyForecast()
        Retrieve the limit for the number of hourly forecast displayed in the Today tab.
        Returns:
        The limit (between 1 and 24).
